            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_1">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="insurance"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Insurance
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_2" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>Why bother with insurance?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Insurance goes hand in hand with risk. Everything you do in life involves some sort of risk. Every day you take risks crossing the road, walking past construction sites and breathing polluted air.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The possibilities for risk are endless, so it's wise to have some kind of medical or life insurance. If you have a family, it is in your interest to protect them.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are insurance policies that cover just about every risk you can think of, both physical and financial. Considering the benefits available, with proper planning and arrangement the costs you pay can be very reasonable.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The best way to start is to plan what you require by taking into account all the risks involved in your life.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_1" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_1" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1230737824__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="1230737824__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Insurance FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1230737824__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_3">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_4" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_3" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I identify risk?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The things you need to protect or to be protected against in life can be divided into three basic categories:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">1. Personal protection. This means protection for yourself and your family. You may need insurance for:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Death and disability</li> 
 <li>Medical and health</li> 
 <li>Personal and family income</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">2. Property and assets. You need to protect the things you own, such as:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Your home</li> 
 <li>Household contents</li> 
 <li>Personal belongings</li> 
 <li>Money and valuables</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">3. Liability. If by chance you are held responsible for a negligent act, you may be legally liable to pay damages. So you may need to be covered for:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Your employees (including domestic helpers)</li> 
 <li>Your tenants, if you're a landlord</li> 
 <li>Your rented flat, if you're a tenant</li> 
 <li>Personal and general risks</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I protect my assets?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your assets are your most valuable possessions. They would cost money to replace if they were lost, damaged or stolen. The insurance plans available to protect your assets include:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Property insurance. This protects you against losses arising from damage to your home caused by such things as typhoons, earthquakes, landslides and gas-leak explosions. If you have a mortgage on your home, this type of insurance is compulsory.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Home insurance. This refers to your household belongings, such as furniture, appliances, cameras, computers, jewellery, ornaments, paintings and even the food in your freezer. Most policies also cover your belongings even when they're not in the home, for example, when you take your camera on holiday or wear your jewellery to a party. Some policies also cover personal accident and loss or damage during the decoration or refurbishment of your home.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Travel insurance. This covers you for most of the risks inherent in traveling abroad. Most policies cover personal accident and liability, and loss and theft of your belongings, money and credit cards. Some policies even cover the delay in the arrival of your baggage and extra expenses if your flight is cancelled or delayed. Medical expenses and emergency evacuation are also covered.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is liability insurance?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your assets are your most valuable possessions. They would cost money to replace if they were lost, damaged or stolen. The insurance plans available to protect your assets include:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Statutory liability. If you have domestic helpers, you should compensate them for accidents or loss arising out of and in the course of their employment with you, even if the accident is caused by carelessness. An employees' compensation policy may cover medical expenses, loss of wages, permanent disablement, death and repatriation expenses. If you have a motor vehicle or a pleasure craft, you should also insure yourself against causing damage or injury to others or their property.</li> 
 <li>Third-party liability. If you're a landlord, it is wise to insure yourself against any injury or loss to your tenant or third party while he/she is in your property. If you're a tenant, you can cover yourself for any damage, loss or injury to a third party in relation to the home you're renting, resulting from your negligence. Personal liability insurance will cover you for all non-statutory, third-party risks resulting from negligence, such as property damage or bodily injury you may cause when playing sports.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What types of life insurance are there?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No one likes to think about the possibility of a serious accident or death, so people often avoid thinking about life insurance. While life insurance protects your family should the worst happen, some policies can also provide an excellent way of saving for your future or your retirement. Depending on the type of insurance plan you have, you may get back what you put into a life insurance scheme with interest when the policy matures.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Some life insurance plans carry a savings element. Part of your premium is invested, often with a choice between a guaranteed return on your money or an investment linked to the performance of the financial market. Whole-life and endowment policies are policies that build up a cash value.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">A whole-life policy will stay in force until you die, even if you live up to the age of 100, if you do not wish to cash it in earlier. An endowment policy, on the other hand, matures after a set term of, say, 20 or 30 years.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Both types of policy can accumulate substantial savings. Obviously, the earlier you start, the more you will earn from the policy by the time you retire.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">A disablement cover is often attached to whole-life and endowment policies. A term life insurance policy is taken out for a fixed duration or term and will pay a lump sum if the policyholder dies during the term of the policy. The premiums are reasonable for this type of policy, but there is no savings element to it, so the policy will simply cease at the end of the term, with no payable cash value. A term life policy can be linked to a mortgage, whereby the benefits will decrease as the mortgage is paid off.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What kinds of insurance cover hospital care?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Anyone who has sought private medical care will know the high cost of treatment. Even if you're fit and healthy, it pays to protect yourself and your family. Even a broken finger can be costly to treat.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Health insurance. This will cover you if you need an operation or other hospital care. It will pay in full or in part for the room, medical services and medicines, surgeon's and anesthetist's fees, consultation and outpatient benefits.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Travel insurance. There's nothing worse than falling ill while you're on holiday, especially if you're on a remote island or in a country where you don't speak the local language. Travel insurance will pay for your medical and hospital expenses abroad, and with some policies you will be flown back to your home country for treatment.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I buy a policy?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Today's insurance companies are flexible and accommodating, and buying insurance is a simple procedure once you know what protection you need. Just tell your insurance company what risks you would like covered and the company will usually offer a plan to meet your needs.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">When you have chosen a policy or policies, you will be asked to complete a proposal form. The details you give must be truthful and accurate because the premiums and the terms of the policy will be based on the information you provide. Inaccurate information could render the policy invalid and you would not be able to make a claim.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Once the insurance company has accepted your proposal form, an offer will be made to you. Upon acceptance, you will usually be covered within a very short time.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For each policy you have, you must be satisfied that you and your family are fully covered for all the risks you want to cover. Read the policy carefully to see if it meets your requirements. Check the list of exclusions to see what you are not covered for. If you find anything in it that is not what you expected, or that seems questionable, point it out to the insurer and ask for amendments. Some policies have a short review period. If you are not happy with the cover provided, you may return your policy within the review period for a full refund.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What do I need to do to manage my policy?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Make sure the sum insured is sufficient to cover your needs. Review the policy annually, before renewal, to ensure it keeps up with inflation.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Update your insurance cover regularly to reflect any material changes, such as:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Additional purchases</li> 
 <li>Change of occupation, address, etc</li> 
 <li>Major changes in your health</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Don't keep your insurance arrangements to yourself. Tell your spouse or best friend about your policies in case you are incapacitated when you want to make a claim.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">An insurance policy is a legal document, so you must keep it in a safe place. And remember where you put it!</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How much should my sum insured be?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The sum insured of your policy depends on what kind of policy it is. If you're insuring assets, then you must make sure you are covered for the replacement value of your possessions. For example, if your TV set is stolen, your insurance should cover the cost of buying a new one of exactly the same model.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you're buying life or disability insurance, the amount you insure for depends largely on your needs and how much in premiums you are willing to spend after allowing for your lifestyle and other financial commitments.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Many companies offer packages with various levels of sum insured. Simply weigh the sum insured against the level of premium and then make your choice.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do in the case of loss, damage or injury?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Take whatever steps are necessary to prevent further loss, damage or injury. Report to the police if your policy stipulates that you should. The police will complete a report with a reference number, which you may need when making a claim. Call your insurance company's hotline as soon as possible.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I make a claim?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You should contact your insurance company's claims department as soon as possible. You will then be asked to fill in a claim form and submit documentary evidence to support your claim:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Invoices, receipts and/or estimates for property damage, loss or theft.</li> 
 <li>Full medical evidence and receipts for medical treatment in the case of medical claims.</li> 
 <li>Birth and death certificates for personal accident/life insurance policies where a death benefit is payable.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In liability cases, it is actually the third party who makes the claim so, to a large extent, the claim is out of the policyholder's hands. If the third party is efficient in providing information and evidence, the insurer is in a better position to offer payment to the third party.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_3">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="manage-your-policy-faqs"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Manage your policy
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_9" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I make premium payments for my life insurance policy?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can use HSBC ATM/ Personal Internet Banking/ PPS/ Payment at Bank/ Cheque / Telegraphic Transfers or RewardCash to make premium payments for your life insurance policy. <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/insurance/manage-your-policy/payment-options.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">See details</span><span class="visuallyhidden">See details  This link will open in a new window</span></a>></p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_2" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_2" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-570269679__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-570269679__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Manage Your Policy FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-570269679__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_8">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_11" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_10" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I submit the change of beneficiary through HSBC Internet Banking at any time?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. You can submit instructions via Online Banking and HSBC HK App. We offer 24/7 services except when we're maintaining or upgrading the system.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are applicable policies that can be updated in the change of beneficiaries journey?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can update the beneficiaries for:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>HSBC Life policies (except First Care, LifeCare, Mortgage Protection Plan and Master Premium Protection Plan)</li> 
 <li>policies owned by the same policyholder</li> 
 <li>policies without irrevocable beneficiaries, assignees or charitable giving benefits</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is a secondary beneficiary?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If there aren't any primary beneficiaries living at the time of the life insured's death, the secondary beneficiaries will become the beneficiaries of the policy.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why can't I update beneficiaries via Online Banking and HSBC HK App?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can't update the beneficiaries via Online Banking and HSBC HK App because there's an irrevocable beneficiary, an assignee or a charity nominated for your policy. To update the beneficiaries, you'll need to submit the required form and additional documents.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong><a id="325"></a>Where can I change my beneficiaries via Online Banking and HSBC HK App?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To change the beneficiaries, please follow the steps below.</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Online Banking: go to ‘Policy summary’ under ‘Insurance & pension’ > select your policy > ‘Beneficiaries’</li> 
 <li>HSBC HK App: select your policy under 'Insurance' > "Beneficiaries"</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I receive the policy maturity and claim benefits from my life insurance policy?</strong><br> <br> We support different preferences with regard to how your policy benefits are to be made available to you. You can choose to:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Receive a cheque in the currency your insurance policy is denominated in or in HKD for local settlement; or</li> 
 <li>Receive a bank draft for overseas settlement; or</li> 
 <li>Have the benefit credited directly to the same designated HSBC account from which your premium payments are debited; or</li> 
 <li>Have the benefit transferred to a bank account you have set up anywhere in the world*.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">* subject to verification by the correspondent / beneficiary bank in accordance with local regulatory requirements.<br> <br>  <br> <strong>If I live abroad, how do I make premium payments through telegraphic transfer for my life insurance policy?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you wish to make your premium payments through telegraphic transfer from an overseas location, please contact us through email or by phone. We will be pleased to provide you with all the relevant information.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can find our contact information by clicking the "<a href="/help/contact/">Contact HSBC</a>" tab at the bottom of the "Help and support" page of our website.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How to make an inquiry or lodge a complaint to us on your life insurance policy?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Should you have any inquires or complaints on your life insurance policy, please contact our customer service hotline at <a href="tel:85225838000" class="no-link" role="presentation">2583 8000</a>.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I change my personal information for insurance policy?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Life insurance:<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please complete <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/insurance/life/change-of-customer-information.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">the Change of Customer Information Form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">the Change of Customer Information Form  This link will open in a new window</span></a> and submit your request by either document upload, mailing-in the original form, or submitting the form to an HSBC branch.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For Document Upload<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>you can find the 'Document Upload' function on either a) <a href="https://insurance.hsbc.com.hk/documents-service/upload-document-pws" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">HSBC public website</span><span class="visuallyhidden">HSBC public website  This link will open in a new window</span></a>; b) HSBC Online Banking – select 'My Insurance' > 'Upload insurance Documents' > 'For your policy servicing request';  or c) HSBC Mobile Banking – select 'your life insurance policy' > 'Document upload' > 'For your policy servicing request'.</li> 
 <li>upload the form via 'Document Upload' by selecting 'For you policy servicing request', then fill in the form to give us your instructions.<br> </li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For mailing-in original form<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Please mail to:<br> HSBC Life (International) Limited<br> 18/F Tower 1<br> HSBC Centre<br> 1 Sham Mong Road<br> Kowloon<br> Hong Kong</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">General insurance:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please complete <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/insurance/general-amendment-form.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">the General Insurance Amendment Request Form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">the General Insurance Amendment Request Form  This link will open in a new window</span></a> and submit your request in one of two ways:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>mailing the original form, or faxing/emailing a copy of the original form, to AXA via the contact details given in the form</li> 
 <li>submitting the original form to any HSBC branch</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information provided on the form.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_9">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_12" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_4">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="hsbc-swift-guard"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            HSBC Swift Guard Critical Illness Plan
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_11" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When does my policy become effective?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Once your application is approved and policy is issued, you'll be covered by your HSBC Swift Guard Critical Illness Plan starting from your policy submission date.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_3" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-1746828302__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-1746828302__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other HSBC Swift Guard Critical Illness Plan FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1746828302__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_10">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_13" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_12" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens if my application is not approved?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You'll be notified via SMS if your application is not successful or approved. Please refer to the SMS for details and reasons for rejection. The premium and levy will not be deducted from your HSBC HKD bank account. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I cancel my policy if I change my mind?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can. You can cancel your policy and get a full refund during the cooling-off period. The period is the earlier of the following:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>21 calendar days after the delivery of your policy</li> 
 <li>21 calendar days after the delivery of a cooling-off notice informing you about the availability of your policy</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To cancel your policy, you can submit a 'Request for Life Policy Surrender/Cancellation' instruction via our 'Document upload' service or mail us a signed written notice together with your policy to this address within the cooling-off period:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Life (International) Limited</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">18/F, Tower 1, HSBC Centre,</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">1 Sham Mong Road,</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Kowloon, Hong Kong</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I renew my policy after 10 years?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you cannot renew your policy. However, we offer conversion privileges at the maturity of your policy. Your policy may be converted to a new policy without evidence of insurability on the life of the life insured for a sum insured less than or equal to the sum insured of your policy.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The new policy must be a prevailing product determined by us at the time of policy conversion. The conversion will be subject to prevailing regulatory and HSBC Life's requirements for new application, except for medical underwriting requirements which will be waived. The premium for the new policy will be determined in accordance with HSBC Life's rate table, applicable to that class of policy prevailing at the date of conversion, and the insurance age of the life insured at such date.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is a checkup or medical examination required for this plan?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you don't need to do checkups or medical examinations for HSBC Swift Guard Critical Illness Plan applications. However, as part of the medical underwriting process, we may ask for further information, such as past medical reports or examination results.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will there be a call back? What should I prepare? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We may call you to understand more about your medical-related answers provided in your application and ask you some follow-up medical questions. Please prepare the following medical information:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>the date and details of diagnosis</li> 
 <li>investigations and results</li> 
 <li>treatments and follow-up plans</li> 
 <li>current condition</li> 
 <li>family medical history</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will HSBC offer a medical examination if any of the health questions is answered as yes? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We don't offer complimentary medical examinations for Swift Guard Critical Illness Plan applications.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">However, please provide the medical reports to us for the underwriting review and decision if required. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I am not sure of my health condition. What should I do? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To protect your interests, please consult your doctor before applying if you're not sure whether you may have any diseases listed in the medical questions.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We may rely on information provided by you as the basis for accepting your application and issuing this policy, and we may approve or decline any future claims based on these statements and information.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do you check existing health conditions for policy underwriting?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. To help us understand your health condition for our underwriting and approval purposes, please complete the medical questionnaire during application journey. The questionnaire will ask about your health and medical history.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please notify us in a timely manner if there are any changes or updates to the information provided in medical questionnaire after you submit the application and before you receive the policy. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why can't I move forward with the medical questions and underwriting results for my online application?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We assess the health conditions of the proposed insured based on our underwriting rules for any online application.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you can't proceed with your application due to the underwriting result, please visit our website to learn more about our other products. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is aggregate premium payment? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The aggregate premium payment option allows you to pre-pay the required premiums at a discount. The balance of aggregate premium and non-guaranteed interest refers to the remaining amount after deducting the premiums due. The balance of aggregate premium and non-guaranteed interest can't be withdrawn unless you surrender the policy. A surrender charge will be imposed on the balance before the refund.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will I receive email confirmation after my online application?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. You'll receive confirmation by email with the application details after submitting your online application. Please make sure you have a valid email address recorded with us.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have any questions,  call us on <a href="tel:85225838000" class="no-link" role="presentation">+852 2583 8000</a>.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will I receive SMS confirmation after my online application?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. You'll receive confirmation by SMS to the valid phone number you registered with us.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have any questions, call us on <a href="tel:85225838000" class="no-link" role="presentation">+852 2583 8000</a>.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why do I need to be in Hong Kong when making the application?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">As part of regulatory requirements, we can only have insurance activities with customers located within Hong Kong SAR at the time of application.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens if I miss a premium payment? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is a 30-day grace period for premium payments that are due. If you can't make payment by the end of the grace period, the policy will lapse with effect from the due date of the first unpaid premium.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the policy lapses due to unpaid premiums, you may apply to reinstate the policy within one year from the date it lapsed. For details please refer to policy provision on the <a href="/insurance/products/medical-and-critical-illness/swift-guard/" target="_self">HSBC Swift Guard Critical Illness Plan</a> page.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_11">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_14" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_5">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="vhis"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            HSBC VHIS Plans
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_13" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What if I am infected with COVID-19? Do I get the medical coverage from VHIS Plans?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. As in the case of all medically necessary treatments, eligible expenses on the treatments of COVID-19 infection as well as the adverse reactions to COVID-19 vaccinations (including expenses incurred for hospitalisation, day case procedures and prescribed diagnostic imaging tests in Hong Kong and elsewhere in the world) are covered according to the benefit schedule of your VHIS Plan.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_4" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="589995224__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="589995224__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other HSBC VHIS Plans FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="589995224__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_12">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_15" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_14" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is this plan eligible for tax deduction? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, this is a VHIS certified plan. You can be eligible for a tax deduction if:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>the policyholder is a personal income taxpayer or his/her spouse;</li> 
 <li>the insured person is the policyholder or the policyholder’s “specified relatives” as defined under the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112); and</li> 
 <li>the insured person is a Hong Kong resident*</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(*) Including Hong Kong Identity Card holders, and people aged under 11 who are not Hong Kong Identity Card holders but their parents are Hong Kong Identity Card holders when they were born or adopted. For detailed definitions, please refer to Inland Revenue Ordinance Cap. 112. You may visit <a href="http://www.ird.gov.hk" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">www.ird.gov.hk</span><span class="visuallyhidden">www.ird.gov.hk  This link will open in a new window</span></a> or seek independent tax advice for more information.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may claim tax deductions for the premium paid while the maximum annual tax deductible amount limit is HKD8,000 per insured person. For example, if you purchase certified plans for a total of four insured persons, you may claim up to HKD32,000 (HKD8,000 x 4) as a policyholder.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that this is not a tax advice. If you have any questions regarding tax, please seek independent tax/ legal advice.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is it possible to change the plan type or plan level after the policy becomes effective?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To change the plan type from Flexi Plan to Standard Plan, increase in deductible level, or downgrade the plan level (e.g. from Diamond to Gold plan), you can submit a request before the deadline stated in the renewal notice to change the plan type or plan level without needing to go through underwriting at policy renewal.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To upgrade the plan level (e.g. from Silver to Gold plan) or decrease in deductible level (e.g. from HKD50K to HKD16K), you can submit a request before the deadline stated in the renewal notice to change the plan level but underwriting is required. We may ask you a few questions before we approve the change of plan type.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I apply a VHIS Plan for myself and my family members?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may apply the VHIS Flexi Plan for yourself and your family members such as your spouse, children and parents etc. via our website, HSBC Online Banking or the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can also <a href="https://appointment.hsbc.com.hk/insurance/?config.bbLocaleSettings.defaultLanguage=en" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">book an appointment</span><span class="visuallyhidden">book an appointment  This link will open in a new window</span></a> and head down to an HSBC branch with your family members, or call our application hotline on +852 2233 3130.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will the policy change when there are changes to the insured person’s health condition upon renewal?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. We will not impose any additional rate of premium loading or case-based exclusion(s) or re-underwriting upon renewal. Renewal is guaranteed up to the age of 100 of the insured person</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is a checkup or medical examination required for VHIS?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Checkups or medical examinations are not a requirement for VHIS applications. However, as part of the medical underwriting process, we may ask for further information, such as past medical reports/examination results. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What kind of medical implants do VHIS Flexi Plan cover?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Our VHIS Flexi Plan covers the eligible expenses of medical implants charged on the following items, subject to the terms and conditions:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">specified items implanted in the insured person’s body during surgery or used in replacement procedures which are medically necessary:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(i) pace maker;</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(ii) stents for percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty;</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(iii) monofocal intraocular lens;</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(iv) artificial cardiac valve;</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(v) metallic or artificial joints for joint replacement;</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(vi) prosthetic ligaments for replacement or implantation between bones; and</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(vii) prosthetic intervertebral disc.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For other medical-necessary medical devices placed inside the insured person’s body, the cost of the device shall be payable too.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For details, please always refer to the terms and benefits of provisions together with the benefit schedule.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the definition of 'emergency treatment'? Do I need to submit any pre-authorisation forms?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The definition of ‘Emergency’ under Health Bureau standardised policy terms and conditions is 'an event or situation that Medical Service is needed immediately in order to prevent death, permanent impairment or other serious consequences of the Insured Person's health'.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">A pre-authorisation form is not required in order to receive reimbursement and you can make a submission for a Cashless Arrangement service during your hospital stay prior to discharge.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I obtain my medical card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can access your e-medical card through the HSBC HK Mobile Banking app. Simply register and open your HSBC HK Mobile Banking app and then tap your VHIS insurance policy to view the details. Once you tab “My medical card”, your e-medical card will be ready for use. For details, please refer to the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/insurance/medical/vhis/user-guide.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">user guide</span><span class="visuallyhidden">user guide  This link will open in a new window</span></a> of VHIS. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you prefer to obtain a physical medical card, please submit a written request to us/ upload your request via “Document Upload”. Alternatively, you may call the HSBC Life Service Hotline <a href="tel:852-2583-8000" class="no-link" role="presentation">2583 8000</a> for assistance.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are value-added tax ('VAT') and goods and services tax ('GST') levied on medical fees and expenses charged by the authorities in the locality where the medical service is rendered covered by VHIS?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes. VAT and GST levied on medical fees and expenses that fall within the benefit coverage of VHIS Certified Plans shall be payable as part of the Eligible Expenses according to the terms and benefits.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to provide proof for partner relationships?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No proof or declaration is required for partner relationship. Please note that even though the policyholder can apply for HSBC VHIS for their partner(s) as the life insured of the policy, partner policies are not be eligible for tax deduction under the current laws of Hong Kong. For any enquiries about tax deduction or to obtain more information, please seek independent tax advice or visit <a href="http://www.ird.gov.hk" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">www.ird.gov.hk</span><span class="visuallyhidden">www.ird.gov.hk  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can the proposed insured be a non-HSBC account holder?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, the proposed insured can be a non-HSBC account holder but the policyholder has to be HSBC bank customer.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can a policyholder apply for HSBC VHIS for their grandchildren? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, the policyholder can apply for HSBC VHIS for their grandchildren at any HSBC branch. The policy is entitled to family discount if they apply for HSBC VHIS Flexi Plan with other family members or their family members previously applied for an active HSBC VHIS Flexi Plan.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Note: If the policyholder is neither the parent nor legal guardian of any minor proposed insured (under 18 years old), it is necessary to provide HSBC Life (International) Limited with the written consent of the parent or legal guardian of any minor proposed insured (under age 18) in respect of any insurance application (as a mandatory requirement of the application process).</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please visit our branch or <a href="https://appointment.hsbc.com.hk/insurance/?config.bbLocaleSettings.defaultLanguage=en" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">book an appointment</span><span class="visuallyhidden">book an appointment  This link will open in a new window</span></a> with us if you need help purchasing a VHIS plan for your grandchildren.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    <div class="anchor" id="hsbc-family-protector"></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_13">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_16" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_6">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="hsbc-comprehensive-critical-illness-protection-plan"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            HSBC Family Protector
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_15" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>What is the protection period of the Policy?</strong><br> </h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This Policy provides life coverage up to the Age of 80.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_3" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_5" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="674902278__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="674902278__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other HSBC Family Protector FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="674902278__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_14">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_17" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_16" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I want coverage of more than HKD7,000,000?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The maximum you may apply for online with HSBC Family Protector is HKD7,000,000. If you feel you need more coverage, our Privileged Term Protector offers up to HKD80,000,000. Please visit us in branch if you would like to discuss this option or explore our range of solutions further.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens to my policy after 10 years?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your premium stays the same for the first 10 years, then it'll be adjusted every 10 years until your policy ends. We'll notify you in advance when your premium is due to be adjusted.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will my health condition affect the premiums after the policy is effective?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, your health condition will not affect the premiums. Once your policy is effective, the policy will stay valid (subject to premium adjustment every 10 years) till the age of 80. Age means the policy anniversary at which the policyholder or life insured reaches the specified age based on age at next birthday.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I am expecting a baby, can I purchase the child protection for him/her?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can take out the child protection for all of your biological, step and legally adopted children, including the children you're expecting and planning to have in the future. The child protection covers your children who are aged 15 days to 18 years old. Age refers to the age your child will be on his or her next birthday.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens if additional information is required for my application?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We may call you if additional medical details are required from you for your application. The call may take about 15 to 30 minutes.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have any questions about your submitted application, you can call us at (852) 2583 8000.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I prepare for the call back?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We will call you to understand more about your answers to the medical questions, and we may ask you some follow-up medical questions. Please prepare the following medical information:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>the date and details of diagnosis</li> 
 <li>investigations and results</li> 
 <li>treatments and follow-up plans</li> 
 <li>current condition</li> 
 <li>family medical history</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When does my policy become effective?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Once your application is approved, you'll be covered by your HSBC Family Protector starting from the date when you submit your application.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens if my application is not successful?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You'll be notified via SMS if your application is not successful. The premium and levy will not be deducted from your HSBC HKD bank account or HSBC HKD credit card.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I pay my premiums by autopay. What should I do if I want to change the account from which I make the payments?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can fill in the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/insurance/life/change-of-premium-instruction.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Change of Premium Instruction form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Change of Premium Instruction form  This link will open in a new window</span></a> and mail it to the following address:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Life (International) Limited</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">18/F, Tower 1, HSBC Centre,</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">1 Sham Mong Road,</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Kowloon, Hong Kong</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can also visit <a href="https://insurance.hsbc.com.hk/" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">My Insurance homepage</span><span class="visuallyhidden">My Insurance homepage  This link will open in a new window</span></a> to update your autopay settings.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have any questions, you can also call us at (852) 2233 3130.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens if I miss a premium payment?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is a 30-day grace period for premium payments that are due. If you cannot make the payment by the end of the grace period, the policy will lapse with effect from the due date of the first unpaid premium.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I update my correspondence address?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can update your address by filling in the <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/insurance/life/change-of-customer-information.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Change of Customer Information form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Change of Customer Information form  This link will open in a new window</span></a> or call our customer service hotline to receive the forms via fax.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The form can be submitted to your nearest HSBC branch or mailed to the following address:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Life (International) Limited</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">18/F, Tower 1, HSBC Centre,</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">1 Sham Mong Road,</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Kowloon, Hong Kong</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What if I change my mind after purchasing the policy? Can I cancel my basic plan or the additional benefits?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can. Each policy includes a cooling-off period during which you have the right to cancel the policy and obtain a full refund. The period refers to the earlier of the following:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">21 calendar days after the delivery of your policy</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">21 calendar days after the delivery of a notice informing you about the availability of your policy</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To cancel your basic plan or additional benefits, you can mail a signed written notice together with your policy to the following address within the cooling-off period:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Life (International) Limited</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">18/F, Tower 1, HSBC Centre,</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">1 Sham Mong Road,</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Kowloon, Hong Kong</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your cooling-off period has expired, you can cancel your basic plan or additional benefits before the end of your policy without any charge.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I make a claim for my Family Protector basic plan?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call us on (852) 3128 0122 and we can assist you in preparing your claim requests. You can visit our <a href="/insurance/claims/" target="_self">Claims and Assistance Services</a> page for more details.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I make a claim for my additional benefits? What happens to my basic plan and other benefits after I've made a claim?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call us on (852) 3128 0122 and we can assist you in preparing your claim requests. You can visit our <a href="/insurance/claims/" target="_self">Claims and Assistance Services</a> page for more details. Making a claim for one of your benefits would not affect your basic plan and other benefits.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

    </div>
</div>
</div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_15">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
