            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_7">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="travelsurance"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            TravelSurance
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_17" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>Can non-HKID holders apply for TravelSurance?</strong><br> </h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><br> Yes, non-HKID holders can apply for TravelSurance via HSBC Branches, as long as the trip starts from, and returns to, the Hong Kong SAR.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_4" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_6" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-714910562__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-714910562__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other TravelSurance FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-714910562__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_16">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_19" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_18" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can a child aged under 18 apply for TravelSurance if they are not travelling with adult?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If cover is required for children under 18 years old, parent’s or legal guardian’s<sup><a href="#fn-legalguardiantravelsurance" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">1</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 1</span></a></sup> information must be provided during the application process. For children aged under 12 years old, they must be accompanied by an adult during the trip.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I buy the TravelSurance for my friends or my friends' child(ren)?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can buy TravelSurance for your friends and your friends’ child(ren) who is/are under 18 years old by providing your friend’s full name, HKID number and date of birth.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If cover is required for children under 18 years old, parent’s or legal guardian’s<sup><a href="#fn-legalguardiantravelsurance" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">1</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 1</span></a></sup> information must be provided during the application process. For children under 12 years old, they must be accompanied by an adult during the trip.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>In case of emergency, how can I contact AXA for assistance?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call the Emergency Assistance Hotline on <a href="tel:85225289333" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2528 9333</a> at any time for emergency medical and evacuation assistance, travel information, baggage assistance, medical referrals, legal referrals and emergency ticketing. The hotline operates in English, Cantonese and Mandarin.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I manage my policy in case I want to extend the covered period during my travel?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Should you have any queries about your policy, including request to extend the covered period, you can call our insurance service hotline at <a href="tel:85228678678" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2867 8678</a> (during office hours) or manage your policy at ease by e-Policy servicing after logging onto HSBC Online Banking if you are an HSBC Online Banking customer. This online service provides you with 24-hour access to your policy details and allows you to submit policy service requests without hassle. Please note the covered period can be extended during travelling if you give us the notice of change before the start date of the extension while the policy is still in force. However, please note any extension is subject to AXA’s approval.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What if I’m being confined in an overseas hospital but not able to speak the local language, is the interpretation service fee covered under the policy?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In case you are confined in overseas hospital for over 24 hours due to accidental bodily injury or sickness during the trip and appoint a local translator referred by Emergency Assistance Service, a maximum of HKD500 per day subject to a HKD5,000 per trip is payable for the interpretation service.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong> </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the catch-up ticket benefit under in case of travel delay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are insured under Asia or Worldwide Standard Plan, in the event the common carrier in your original travel itinerary is delayed during the trip for more than 6 hours due to covered conditions and you decide to buy another one-way travel ticket to catch up with the planned itinerary, the additional and reasonable cost of the ticket replacement will be reimbursed, up to HKD2,000 for Asia Standard Plan and HKD4,000 for Worldwide Standard Plan.<br> Please note that cash allowance and trip re-routing benefits will not be payable if catch-up ticket benefit is paid, and vice versa.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What kind of sports and activities are covered by TravelSurance?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">TravelSurance covers various kinds of sports and activities provided that they are not played in professional capacity or in competition involving prize money or reward of any kind. For example, you are covered for dune driving, sand boarding, safari adventures, whale tours, hot springs, horse riding, cable cars, iceberg climbing, watching auto racing, water sports, skiing, ice-skating, biking, thrill rides at amusement parks etc.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">TravelSurance also covers hazardous sports activities such as hot air ballooning, bungee jumping, hang-gliding, parachuting, zipline, rafting, speed-boating, jet-skiing, trekking, water skiing, wakeboarding, wakesurfing, sea kayaking, scuba-diving (that is diving to a depth not greater than 40 metres), mountaineering, rock-climbing etc.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To see what you’ll be covered for under TravelSurance, <a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/insurance/travel/the-policy.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">check the full list</span><span class="visuallyhidden">check the full list  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What extra protection can I receive if a Travel Alert is issued for the planned destination?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Except Greater Bay Area plan, you will be protected against the issuance of the Travel Alert in the following ways, provided that no claim has been paid. Before the trip, you may:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>upon any Travel Alert, cancel your Single Trip policy and receive a full premium and levy<sup><a href="#fn-insurance-travelsurance-levyrefund" data-back-link-connected=""><span aria-hidden="true">2</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Footnote link 2</span></a></sup> refund;</li> 
 <li>upon Red Travel Alert (except for the reason of a pandemic), be reimbursed up to 50% of the irrecoverable deposits or charges paid in advance upon cancellation of trip up to HKD50,000 for Standard Plan and HKD25,000 for Basic Plan.</li> 
 <li>upon Black Travel Alert (except for the reason of a pandemic), be reimbursed up to 100% of the irrecoverable deposits or charges paid in advance upon cancellation of trip up to HKD50,000 for Standard Plan and HKD25,000 for Basic Plan.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">During the trip, you may:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>upon any Travel Alert, have your insurance automatically extended for 10 days free if your trip is unavoidably delayed;</li> 
 <li>upon Red Travel Alert, be reimbursed up to 50% of the unused irrecoverable prepaid costs or additional travel-related costs upon curtailment of trip for up to HKD50,000 for Standard Plan and HKD25,000 for Basic Plan.</li> 
 <li>upon Black Travel Alert, be reimbursed up to 100% of the unused irrecoverable prepaid or additional travel-related costs upon curtailment of trip for up to HKD50,000 for Standard Plan and HKD25,000 for Basic Plan.</li> 
 <li>upon Black Travel Alert, obtain an additional HKD1,000 allowance to subsidise any unexpected cost due to curtailment of trip or unavoidable delay of the scheduled trip.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I claim for medical expenses incurred during my trip for any sickness or disease?</strong><br> <br> The policy covers medical expenses incurred provided that such sickness or disease is not in existence prior to the trip, and not caused by:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>an event of same nature mentioned in the black or red travel alert (except for the reason of COVID-19), unless the journey has been started before the issuance of such travel alerts</li> 
 <li>claims relating to the vaccine-preventable diseases if prior to the trip: (i) the insured person fails to obtain the related vaccine; and (ii) the vaccine is mandatorily required by the government(s) of Hong Kong SAR and/or the destination where the insured person has planned to travel.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For Greater Bay Area Plan, this benefit is only applicable for medical treatment requiring hospitalisation.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the virtual medical consultation service about and how can I use this?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have taken out the MultiTrip Worldwide Plan, you are entitled to 6 free virtual medical consultations per period of insurance by using MyDoc Health Passport. The consultations are usually available during local doctors’ office hours. Following a virtual medical consultation, you may choose to obtain the prescribed medication and have it delivered to your doorstep as needed during specific hours; however, this will incur charges which you will need to pay first and may then claim in accordance with your policy if eligible.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The virtual medical consultation is currently available in Tokyo, Osaka, Hokkaido and Fukuoka for Japan, and countrywide for Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You will receive a confirmation email with a step-by-step guide on how to use the virtual medical consultation service.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note the above details are subject to change without prior notice.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is an epidemic/ pandemic considered as a natural disaster?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Natural Disaster does not include epidemic or pandemic.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_17">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_20" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_8">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="motor-insurance"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Motor Insurance
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_19" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>Which documents make up my Insurance Policy?</strong><br> </h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your Application Policy Schedule and Policy Wording together make up your insurance policy. Please read the related documents together to make sure you know what covered is provided and any terms and conditions that may apply. Also, the Certificate of Insurance in the pack should always be kept with you in your car as proof of insurance.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_5" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_7" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="282381384__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="282381384__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Motor Insurance FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="282381384__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_18">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_21" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_20" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I make a change to my Policy?</strong><br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You have to inform AXA if there are any changes of the insured items or personal details of the policyholder and insured. You may call AXA at (852) 2867 8678 or email <a href="mailto: axa.bank.gi@axa.com.hk.">axa.bank.gi@axa.com.hk.</a></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is No Claim Discount (NCD)?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No Claim Discount (NCD) is a reward to you (the insured) for no claim is made to the policy during any of the periods of insurance specified below. You will earn a 10% discount on the renewal premium with a maximum of 60% discount if no claim is made for 5 consecutive years with the details as below:</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(Application to Private Car only)</p>

</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-NTCTBL-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div class="table-wrapper c-999" data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="content_main_notice_table_1">
     <table width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="1" border="1">
<tbody><tr><th style="text-align: center;"><strong>Period of Insurance</strong></th>
<th style="text-align: center;"><strong>No claims Discount<br>
(On Renewal Premium)</strong></th>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">One year</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">20%</td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">2 consecutive years</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">30%</td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">3 consecutive years</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">40%</td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">4 consecutive years</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">50%</td>
</tr><tr><td style="text-align: center;">5 or more consecutive years</td>
<td style="text-align: center;">60%</td>
</tr></tbody></table>

</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_21" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If a claim is made or being claimed during a period of insurance of which you are entitling NCD 40% or less, your NCD will be forfeited and resume from 0% at the renewal year.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If a claim is made or being claimed during a period of insurance of which you are entitling NCD 50% or 60%, your NCD will be reduced to 20% or 30% at the renewal year respectively. However, if you make more than one claim or being claimed, your NCD will be forfeited and resumed from 0% at the renewal year.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is M.I.B.?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">M.I.B. ("Motor Insurers' Bureau of Hong Kong") is a company incorporated in Hong Kong and limited by guarantee. All motor insurance policies issued in Hong Kong must contribute a levy based on the policy premium to M.I.B., this M.I.B. surcharge will be included and shown in the premium breakdown on Policy Schedule. It provides compensation to victims of traffic accidents where the drivers concerned are uninsured or untraceable, or the insurers concerned are insolvent.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why sum insured is not required during application?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">AXA gives you a hassle free to assess the car value every year. AXA will indemnify you against loss of or damage to your car based on the Market Value of the insured car at the time of loss. Market Value means the cost of replacing the insured car with one of the same make and model, of similar condition, specification and age as prevailing immediately before the accident. Thus, sum insured is not required for this.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is "Excess"? What kind of "Excess" applies to me?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Excess is the amount of that you have to contribute towards the cost of a claim, it will be applicable depending on the type of claim made as well as the person is driving the insured car at the time of the accident.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">General Excess is applicable to the loss of or damage to the insured car for Comprehensive Cover only.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Third Party Property Excess is applicable to any claim for indemnity against liabilities for third party property damage.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Young Driver Excess is applicable if the person, who is driving the insured car at the time of accident, is below the age of twenty five (25) years old.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Inexperienced Driver Excess is applicable if the person, who is driving the insured car at the time of accident, has held a valid driving license for a period less than 2 years.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Unnamed Driver Excess is applicable if the person, who is driving the insured car at the time of accident, is not named in the Policy Schedule or Certificate of Insurance but who is authorized by the policyholder to drive the insured car.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Theft Loss Excess is applicable to the insured car if a claim is arising out of theft or attempted theft.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Parking Damage Excess is applicable to the insured car if the loss or damage occurs whilst the insured car is parked.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the insured driver is aged 25 below, holding a valid driving license less than 2 years and not named in the Policy Schedule at the time of accident, where Young Driver Excess, Inexperience Driver Excess and Unnamed Driver Excess are all applicable at the same time, these three excesses will be calculated cumulatively in addition to General Excess or Third Party Property Excess whichever is applicable.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why the Policy Schedule is not given?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the Vehicle Registration Number is not provided, you will only receive the Certificate of Insurance at the time of policy issuance. Please contact AXA at (852) 2867 8678 or email to <a href="mailto:Email to: motor.claims@axa.com.hk">axa.bank.gi@axa.com.hk</a> within 14 days of policy issuance to provide your Vehicle Registration Number. AXA will email you the Policy Schedule, updated Certificate of Insurance and other related documents.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is NCD Protection (applicable to Comprehensive Cover only)?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Under No Claim Discount (NCD) Protection, if the total claims in aggregate during the current Period of Insurance do not exceed the amount of HKD60,000 or 30% of the insured car's reasonable market value (whichever is the lesser) then you will be entitled to the same NCD upon renewal. However, NCD Protection does not apply if NCD is to be transferred to any other insurance company for whatever reason including non-renewal by both parties. In addition, NCD Protection also does not apply if your insured car falls under the Car Grouping 99 as set out in the Policy Schedule.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is Rental Car (applicable to Comprehensive Cover only)?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">When your car is being repaired exceeding 48 hours due to a car accident necessitating immobilized, or being stolen and not found within 48 hours, AXA will reimburse the cost of rental car given the make and model of the rental car is identical or similar to your car, and not better nor more expensive than your car; however you have the named driver has to bear 20% of the rental costs.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I take "Third Party Only" Cover and also select Add-on benefit of "Personal Accident to the Named Driver", will this optional cover apply to all named drivers of my policy?</strong><br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Add-on benefit "Personal Accident to the Named Driver" under "Third Party Only" Cover only applies to the named driver, who aged between 18 and 70 years old at the time of accident sustains bodily injury.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I change the policy details after the policy has been issued?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can change the policy details (eg. addition of named driver) but premium, terms and conditions may be different from originally given. Please call our insurance services hotline at (852) 2867 8678 or email to <a href="mailto:Email to: motor.claims@axa.com.hk">axa.bank.gi@axa.com.hk</a> for enquiry.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is the premium guaranteed to remain unchanged during the period of insurance and upon policy renewal?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The premium is based on a number of factors including the type of cover, the Add-on benefits you choose, the car to be insured and driver profiles but it is not guaranteed to remain unchanged. AXA reserve the right to adjust premiums if considered to be necessary.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can non Hong Kong resident apply for Motor Insurance?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. We only accept application from Hong Kong resident who has valid HKID and Hong Kong Driving License.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I manage and renew my Motor Insurance policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call our insurance services hotline (852) 2867 8678 or email to <a href="mailto:Email to: motor.claims@axa.com.hk">axa.bank.gi@axa.com.hk</a> should you have any queries about your policy and may receive your insurance renewal notice email at least 1 month before your policy expiry date. This will contain your next year's premium and terms and conditions.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I cancel my Motor Insurance policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can cancel your policy at any time by giving AXA a 7-days in-advance notice (provided no claim has arisen during the current Period of Insurance and the Current Certificate of Insurance has been returned to AXA on or before the date of cancellation). You shall be entitled to a pro-rata refund of premium for the period the Policy is not in force subject to a minimum non-refundable premium of amount HKD$500 (not including M.I.B. surcharge) for policy cancellation.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What do I do in the event of an accident?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In the event of a traffic accident, please remember to:<br>
</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
<li>Keep calm and report to the Police immediately;<br>
</li>
<li>Obtain the third party driver's particulars including name, contact number and insurer (if known);</li>
<li>Record the registration number of third party's vehicle;</li>
<li>Record the damage condition (by taking photo);</li>
<li>If there are any witnesses, note their names and contact numbers;</li>
<li>Call our 24-hour assistance hotline at (852) 2851 1990 if you need our assistance including emergency roadside assistance^, towing of the motor car^, rental vehicle^, general information of traffic regulation, advice on claim procedure, etc.;</li>
<li>Call 24-hour accident assistance hotline at (852) 2851 1990 to have your repairs at AXA Premium Workshops;</li>
<li>Inform AXA as soon as possible with full particulars;</li>
<li>Immediately notify AXA or forward to AXA every letter, claim, writ, summons and process. Please do not answer by yourself.</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I make a claim?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In order to get your claim processed promptly, please provide AXA the following:<br>
</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
<li>a completed duly signed claim form;<br>
</li>
<li>a copy of the valid Vehicle Registration Document (both sides) of the insured car;</li>
<li>a copy of the insured driver's HKID and Driving Licence;</li>
<li>a Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance Data Access Request Form and Letter of Authorization signed by the driver;</li>
<li>repair quotation from the repairer, if applicable;</li>
<li>a copy of the Screening Breath Test Result Form, if applicable;</li>
<li>Police Correspondence, including Notice of Intended Prosecution, police statements, etc.;</li>
<li>copy of any third party correspondence, summons or writs.</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Submit to AXA by:</p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
<li>Mail to: P.O. Box No. 91012 Tsim Sha Tsui Post Office, Kowloon, Hong Kong;<br>
</li>
<li>Fax to: (852) 2285 6237;</li>
<li>Email to: <a href="mailto:motor.claims@axa.com.hk">motor.claims@axa.com.hk</a>;</li>
<li>Fill out HSBC online claim form.</li>
</ol>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Pay attention:</p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
<li>Notify AXA within 7 days of the accident;</li>
<li>Do not admit liability, make any offer, promise anything or make payment to any other party without AXA's written consent;</li>
<li>Notify AXA immediately if you know about any impending prosecution, inquest or fatal inquiry in connection with the accident.</li>
</ol>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

    <div class="anchor" id="Rewards"></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_19">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_22" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_9">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="residencesurance"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            ResidenceSurance
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_22" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>I live in my home which is owned by my parents and they do not live with me. What cover can ResidenceSurance offer me as "occupier" in this situation?</strong></h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are an occupier (but neither you nor your family members are tenants), ResidenceSurance provides 3 major coverages:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>accidental loss of and damage to your and your family's household contents and valuables, desktop computer/laptop computer/tablet computer in your home;</li> 
 <li>accidental loss of and damage to personal effects and valuables, desktop computer/laptop computer/tablet computer of you and your family members occurring anywhere in the world; and</li> 
 <li>your, your family member's and your domestic helper's personal liability as a result of accidental injury/property damage to a third party. Furthermore, if you wish to have a better coverage for your personal property (e.g. jewellery, watches, etc.), you may select the top-up worldwide all risks and specified item add-ons that best fit your needs.</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_6" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_8" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1617959984__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="1617959984__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other ResidenceSurance FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1617959984__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_20">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_23" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_23" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How does ResidenceSurance cover my home if I’m going to renovate my home by engaging a renovation contractor?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ResidenceSurance covers the accidental damage and loss of property according to the Household Contents cover in Section 1 during the first 4-month of the renovation period (not applicable to Plan1). Also, household contents which are temporarily moved away from home, e.g. moved to mini-storage facilities, will be covered for accidental damage and loss.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is covered if I’m going to move Home?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ResidenceSurance covers:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>accidental loss of and damage to household contents and valuables occurring in the course of removal by professional removers between the Home and any new permanent residence within Hong Kong (not applicable to Plan A and B);</li> 
 <li>accidental loss of and damage to household contents and valuables at the new Home for a period of 2 months from the beginning of the lease (where you lease the property) or from the first time of occupation of the Home (where you own the property)(not applicable to Plan A and B); and</li> 
 <li>accidental loss of and damage to household contents temporarily away from the Home in locations including ministorage facilities, work locations and rented locations of policyholder and his relatives.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Some of my electrical appliances are fairly old. Will they be covered?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ResidenceSurance provides cover for accidental loss of or damage to household contents regardless of whether the insured items are new or old. Regarding the indemnity of the loss, they are covered on a “New For Old” basis, without any deduction for depreciation. If the appliances are stolen or beyond repair due to accidental damage, they will be replaced by a new article of the same kind which is of similar but not better quality. If there are no longer any No Better-off items in the market due to technology or product advancement, we will take reference from market price of the nearest current model available in the market at the time of claim, and then apply a reduction percentage on the market price proportional to the “betterment” of the current model over the lost or damaged item.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How I can insure my valuables?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">ResidenceSurance’s Plan 1, 2, 3 & 4 have automatic coverage of valuables accidentally lost or damaged at home up to the specified sum insured and per item limits. If you want more coverage, ResidenceSurance covers valuables up to HKD80,000 per item and additional HKD500,000 in aggregate sum insured under the optional rider of “Top-up Worldwide “All Risks”” (only for plan 3 and 4 and annual premium payment mode). You can also insure valuables exceeding such limits on specified item basis at agreed values with the designated application form for specified items, subject to underwriting approval. You cannot claim under both Section 1 and 5, or under both 2 and 5, for the loss or damage of the of the same item.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I apply for "Energy-efficiency" benefit? In a claim, can my household item be replaced with one with a better energy saving standard?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the claim relates to the replacement of a damaged refrigerator, room cooler, washing machine, electric clothes dryer or electric storage water heater which is covered under the policy and bears a Grade 3, 4 or 5 energy saving level , we will replace the item with an item that bears a “Grading Type” energy label of Grade 2, or to Grade 1 if no Grade 2 item is available in the Hong Kong market. For the replacement of any of these appliances which bears a Grade 2 energy saving level, we will replace it with a new item of similar specification with Grade 1 energy saving level. If your damaged appliance does not bear any energy saving label, we will replace with one of similar specification with a minimum of a “Recognition Type” energy saving labeling level or equivalent with a minimum Grade 2 energy saving label, whichever is available in the Hong Kong market. Provided the energy saving label is recognized by Electrical and Mechanical Service Department and the upgrade payment will not be more than HKD5,000 for any one item.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will the premium and levy<sup><a href="#^"><span aria-hidden="true">^</span><span class="visuallyhidden">^ View footnote ^</span></a></sup> change?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The renewal premium may change due to aging of the residential building, inflation, claim experience or other factors but we will inform you in advance of the change before renewal. The premium may also be adjusted if the identity of the policyholder in relation to the use of the insured premises is changed (e.g. change from a landlord (non-renting out) to a tenant) . Levy is paid to the Insurance Authority and it depends on the levy rate announced by the Insurance Authority.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Are there any excesses for claims? What is the excess if I take the optional cover – Top- up worldwide all risk?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may refer to the excess details at the Sum Insured Table in this factsheet and the policy schedule required for the relevant sections.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have selected the optional-cover of Top-up Worldwide “All Risks” (Section 5), the excess will follow the excess of the option you have chosen under Section 5. However, if the benefit payable according to the item limit and excess of Section 2 (which is the basic worldwide “All Risks“ cover) would be higher than that of Section 5, then the item limit and excess of Section 2 should apply instead of that of Section 5.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I manage my policy?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call (852) 2867 8678 should you have any queries about your policy, or manage your policy at ease by e-Policy Servicing after logging on to HSBC Internet Banking if you are a HSBC internet banking customer. This online service provides you with 24-hour access to your policy details.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><span class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL">^<a id="^"></a>Levy collected by the Insurance Authority will be imposed on this policy at the applicable rate. For further information, please visit or contact AXA at (852) 2867 8678.</span><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_21">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_24" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_10">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="accidentsurance"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            AccidentSurance
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_24" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>How do you classify an incident as an Accident?</strong><br> </h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">An accident is an unexpected, unforeseeable and external event, such as a fall or a car crash, which causes physical injury like a broken limb or torn muscle. A disease or an illness is not classified as an accident.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_7" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_9" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-1771666670__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-1771666670__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other AccidentSurance FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-1771666670__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_22">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_25" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_25" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What types of medical expenses are covered under this plan? Can I claim for outpatient expenses incurred through sickness?</strong><br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you sustain an accidental injury, such as a broken arm, this insurance plan will cover you for any necessary and reasonable expenses incurred for in-hospital and outpatient medical, surgical or nursing treatment, including the costs of medical supplies, ambulance hire or professional home-nursing fees. However, the cost of dental care and treatment is not covered unless such treatment is an emergency and is caused by accidental injury to sound natural teeth.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">As sickness is not classified as an accident, the medical expenses incurred cannot be covered under this plan.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>My son is planning to study abroad for a few years. Can he be covered under the policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The insured person must be resident in Hong Kong at the time of their application. If they subsequently live abroad for a continued period or study overseas, they will still be covered under AccidentSurance.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I'm now working for the Hong Kong Police Force as an internal supporting staff. Will I be covered during working hours? Will the protection be continued if I take up an operational role later? Should I report when I change my occupation?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, supporting staff of the Hong Kong Police Force are covered under the plan during working hours provided that they are carrying out clerical duties. However, if you take up an operational role, you will no longer be covered for any accident incurred at the time of carrying out duties.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You are not required to inform us of any change of occupation. However we advise you to review whether your new job is classified as one of the excluded occupations under the policy exclusion.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is any proof required when I submit a claim?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You are required to fill in a claim form and submit documentary evidence (at your expense) to support the claim:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
<li>For claims of accidental death or injury benefits, the claimant has to submit reports such as medical reports, attending physician's report, police reports, death certificate, the coroner's report and other related documents;</li>
<li>For claims of medical expenses or Chinese bonesetter expenses, the claimant has to submit full medical evidence, original receipts and other related documents of medical treatment.</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If any medical expenses or Chinese bonesetter expenses have been fully paid by another insurer or employer, can I also claim reimbursement under AccidentSurance?</strong><br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, we will only be liable for the excess of the amount recoverable from another source. However, the cash benefit for accidental death and disability will not be affected by other insurance covers.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I suffered an injury when riding on a motorcycle as a passenger. Can I be covered under AccidentSurance?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, AccidentSurance excludes accidental injury or accidental death directly or indirectly caused by or resulting from motorcycling and other listed hazardous activities.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does AccidentSurance cover acupuncture, Chinese herbal treatment and dental treatment costs?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The insurance plan provides cover for Chinese bonesetter expenses and emergency dental treatment caused by accidental injury to sound natural teeth only, but does not cover the cost of acupuncture and Chinese herbal treatment.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is the premium guaranteed to remain unchanged?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The premium depends on the coverage options (Self, Self & Spouse, Self & Children, Self & Family) and plan level (Plan 1 / Plan 2), and generally does not increase with age or be affected by your health condition. However, we reserve the right to adjust premiums for particular categories of insured persons if considered to be necessary. We will, however, give you sufficient written notification in advance.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I manage my policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call 2867 8678 should you have any queries about your policy, or manage your policy at ease by e-Policy Servicing after logging on to HSBC Internet Banking if you are a HSBC internet banking customer. This online service provides you with 24-hour access to your policy details and allows you to submit policy service requests without hassle.</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_23">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_26" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_11">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="fire-insurance"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Fire Insurance
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_26" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>What will be covered by Fire Insurance? What if the damages incurred from some other natural hazards like typhoon, flood etc., will it be covered?</strong><br> </h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Fire Insurance covers your home structure, or fixing and fittings, against hazard and provides you with the financial resources to replace what you have lost. <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are two plans for selection, one is Standard Cover and the other is Comprehensive Cover.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Here outlines the features of Standard Cover:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Fire and lightning</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Explosion</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Typhoon, windstorm and flood</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Landslide and subsidence</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Earthquake</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Here outlines the features of Comprehensive Cover:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Fire and lightning</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Explosion</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Typhoon, windstorm and flood</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Landslide and subsidence</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Earthquake</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Damage caused by aircraft</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Vehicle impact (caused by a third party's vehicle)</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Riot and strike</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Malicious damage</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">- Burst or overflow of water tanks, apparatus & pipes</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The above information is intended as a general summary. Please refer to the policy wording for exact terms and conditions and details of the exclusions.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_8" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_10" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="321264443__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="321264443__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Fire Insurance FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="321264443__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_24">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_27" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_27" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will the damage of the electrical machines be covered?</strong><br></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Damage to any electrical machine or apparatus arising from its own over-running, excessive pressure, short-circuiting, self-heating, arcing or leakage of electricity arising from whatever cause (lightning included) will not be covered under this Policy.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I still apply the Fire Insurance if my mortgage loan is not with HSBC?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Fire Insurance is underwritten by AXA General Insurance Hong Kong Limited which is authorised and regulated by the Insurance Authority of the Hong Kong SAR. The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited is registered in accordance with the Insurance Ordinance as an insurance agent of AXA General Insurance Hong Kong Limited for distribution of general insurance products in the Hong Kong SAR. This Policy will still be accepted even your home mortgage loan is not provided by HSBC.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I manage my insurance policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call Insurance Service Hotline at (852)2867 8678 should you have any queries about your policy, or manage your policy at ease by e-Policy Servicing after logging on to HSBC Internet Banking if you are a HSBC internet banking customer. This online service provides you with 24-hour access to your policy details and allows you to submit policy service requests without hassle.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is the premium guarantee to remain unchanged?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The premium of Fire Insurance depends on the sum insured amount and plan chosen which is not guarantee to remain unchanged. AXA General Insurance Hong Kong Limited reserves the rights to adjust premiums for particular categories of the insured home if considered to be necessary. AXA General Insurance Hong Kong Limited will, however, give you sufficient written notification in advance.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>My property is more than 40 years of age, does it fulfill the application requirement?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Underwriting will be required if the age of property is 40 years old or above.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I'm the owner of a Café located in a building, can I apply the Fire Insurance for my cafe?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The insured property must not be used for any commercial purposes and is situated in a permanent residential building in Hong Kong SAR.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I'm the tenant of my apartment, can I apply Fire Insurance for this property?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Under this Policy, you must be/will be the legal owner of this insured property by the Policy Commencement Date, the tenant of the property does not qualified and does not need to apply this Policy.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I already have a Home Insurance Policy, do I still need the Fire Insurance?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">These two policies are different. Home Insurance protects household contents inside the house, such as furniture, electrical appliances, improved fixtures and fittings, etc, and personal belongings that you take when you're out of home. <br> Fire Insurance covers the building structure such as walls, windows, ceiling, floor, pipes and the property's original fixtures and fittings. Fire Insurance claims can be made for damage caused by fire and other named perils such as typhoon and landslide, explosion, etc. Therefore, the covers are complementary. If you need comprehensive protection, you may consider buying both insurance policies.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How much of the sum insured I should purchase for this Policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The insured can select the original mortgage loan value, property reinstatement cost, or current mortgage loan value as the sum insured for the fire insurance policy. If the insured has chosen the property reinstatement cost option, the insurance coverage will be subject to change according to the annual property valuation. The policy is subject to a minimum non-refundable premium of HKD 400.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_25">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_28" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_12">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="helpershield-insurance"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            HelperShield Insurance
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_28" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How HelperShield Insurance cover my liability as an employer when my foreign domestic helper is accompanying me or my family member(s) to take overseas trips?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HelperShield Insurance provides a worldwide coverage up to HKD100,000,000 per event under Section 1 Employees' Compensation for your liability as an employer to your foreign domestic helper when, on a mutual consent basis ,your foreign domestic helper follows you/your family members to go abroad for vacation and perform his/ her duty for household chores as the foreign domestic helper during the overseas trips. AXA will not be liable for any judgment against you which is delivered by or obtained from a court outside Hong Kong SAR. Also, AXA will not be liable for a judgment or order obtained in the Hong Kong SAR for the enforcement of a judgment obtained outside Hong Kong SAR. Please be reminded to observe the relevant visa requirements, laws and regulations of the destination country/territory before you decide to take your foreign domestic helper for overseas trips and particular attention to the insurance arrangements, e.g. travel insurance for leisure travel and cover the foreign domestic helper's medical expenses, personal belongings, personal liability, etc.  No coverage under HelperShield Insurance will be provided if your foreign domestic helper has bodily injury or death by accident or disease which does not arise out of performing  his or her duty other than household chores during the overseas trips.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_9" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_11" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1827699355__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="1827699355__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other HelperShield Insurance FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1827699355__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_26">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_29" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_29" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can my foreign domestic helper get covered under HelperShield Insurance for his/her bodily injury and sickness sustained before the policy inception date?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Any claim arising from pre-existing condition for which the Insured Helper had received medical treatment, diagnosis, consultation or prescribed drugs prior to this Period of Insurance is excluded. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For Sections 2 - Hospital Expenses, Section 3 – Clinical Expenses, Section 4 – Dental Expenses and Section 8 – Service Interruption Allowance, we do not cover for the bodily injury, sickness or disease sustained by the foreign domestic helper before inception of the policy and resulting in medical treatment received within 3 consecutive months immediately before inception of the policy, but if no medical treatment is incurred on such bodily injury, sickness or disease within 3 consecutive months immediately after inception of the policy, benefits under those sections shall subsequently become effective. In addition, items or events listed in the exclusions are not covered throughout the period of insurance. Please refer to the policy for full details of the exclusions.  </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will HelperShield Insurance cover my liability to medical expense and repatriation expense  incurred by my foreign domestic helper who sustains the bodily injury or sickness on his/her "day- off" within Hong Kong SAR?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">According to Labour Department, an employer needs to provide free treatment for his/her foreign domestic helper within HKSAR, whether or not the helper's bodily injury or sickness is attributed to his/her work. The medical expenses incurred by the foreign domestic helper within Hong Kong SAR during the period of insurance will be covered under Section 2- Hospital Expenses, Section 3 – Clinical Expenses of HelperShield Insurance and Section 6 – Repatriation Expenses.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In the event of the insured foreign domestic helper's death or the foreign domestic helper is being certified by a qualified and licensed / registered medical practitioner of western medicine as medically unfit to complete the term of contract of employment as a result of sickness or bodily injury, AXA will reimburse the insured the necessary and reasonable expenses actually incurred in repatriating the foreign domestic helper under Section 6 – Repatriation Expenses.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I employ multiple local (part-time) domestic helpers who work for me at the same time slots within a day, can I buy only one single policy of HelperShield Insurance cover all of the helpers?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you are required to buy multiple HelperShield policies because one policy only covers one local (part time) domestic helper who work for you at the same time slots within a day. However, if you employ different local (part time) domestic helpers who work for you at different time slots at the same place of employment within the period of insurance, one HelperShield Insurance policy can cover all of them.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to bear any policy excess?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Excess means the amount of each claim payable by you, for any loss or series of losses arising from one source or cause. Some sections of the policy require excess:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Section 2 - Hospital expenses: the first HKD300 per hospital admission</li> 
 <li>Section 7 - Replacement of helper expenses: the first 3 months of the employment or the period for employment agency to replace the Foreign Domestic Helper at no service  fee, whichever is the longer(not applicable for the reason of repatriation).</li> 
 <li>Section 8 - Service interruption allowance: the first 3 consecutive days of hospitalisation as an inpatient</li> 
 <li>Section 10 – Personal liability: the first HKD500 for third party property damage</li> 
 <li>Section 12 – Personal effects: the first HKD300 in each and every claim</li> 
 <li>Optional cover- Supplementary medical (critical illness) benefit: the first HKD300 as a result of cancer</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How to make claims? Who can make a claim?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The policyholder shall give AXA notice in writing immediately of any occurrence likely to give rise to a claim. A detailed statement in writing describing the occurrence should be given to AXA within 30 days of any occurrence that is likely to give rise to a claim under HelperShield Insurance. You may download the claim form at: <a href="/insurance/forms/#claim-forms" target="_self">https://www.hsbc.com.hk/insurance/forms/#claim-forms</a>.  You may submit a claim online anytime or call our claims hotline on (852) 2867 8678 (9:00am to 6:00pm, Monday to Friday and 9:00am to 1:00pm Saturday, except public holiday) should you require any help.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I renew my HelperShield Insurance policy?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The policy of foreign domestic helper/local (part-time) domestic helper is renewed automatically in accordance with the terms and conditions of the policy and up to the age of 64 years old of the insured helper.  We will debit  your designated HSBC credit card which you provided in your application to collect the premium and levy^ for policy renewal. A renewal letter will be sent to you before the policy renewal date.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">^ Levy collected by the Insurance Authority  has been imposed on this policy at the applicable rate. For further information, please visit <a href="https://www.axa.com.hk/en/ia-levy" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">www.axa.com.hk/ia-levy</span><span class="visuallyhidden">www.axa.com.hk/ia-levy  This link will open in a new window</span></a> or contact AXA at <a href="tel:+852-2867-8678" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2867 8678</a>.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>As an existing Helper Insurance's policyholder,  can I now instead change to buying a HelperShield Insurance?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">AXA insures the helper under one policy of similar nature. You may apply for HelperShield Insurance when the existing Helper Insurance policy is expired.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How will AXA inform me if AXA have to cancel my HelperShield Insurance policy? What is the cancellation effective day and is there any premium refund?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">AXA will give notice of cancellation/termination of your HelperShield Insurance policy to you at AXA's last known corresponding address by mail, or merely by electronic means (such as email at your last known email address or SMS message at your last known mobile number), such cancellation/termination shall become effective from the 7th day after such notice has been issued. In such event, AXA will return a proportionate part of the premium, provided there has been no claim for the policy.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_27">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_30" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_13">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="hospitalsurance"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            HospitalSurance
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_30" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>Why are pre-existing conditions not covered? Why are some sicknesses excluded during the first year and some excluded during the first six months?</strong><br> </h3> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Pre-existing conditions are commonly excluded in medical and hospitalisation policies because it is not the insurer's intention to cover the cost of an existing condition. Therefore, it is usual to exclude injuries or sicknesses which occur, exist, commence or present signs or symptoms before the commencement of the policy coverage. The definition of pre-existing condition is defined in the policy document. Please refer to the policy for details.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The sickness listed as exclusions are mostly common chronic illnesses which normally require a development period ranging from six months to one year. Some diseases require a longer range of development cycle to develop symptoms than others. In general, those illnesses excluded during the first year are believed to have a longer development period (e.g. Tumours of internal organs).</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_10" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_12" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-595496314__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-595496314__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other HospitalSurance FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-595496314__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_28">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_31" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_31" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the waiting period?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Medical insurance normally has a term "waiting period" which means no coverage on any illnesses will be offered during that period. To provide you with instant protection, our HospitalSurance does not have waiting period. However, for illnesses that are identified as exclusion at the inception of policy will not be covered at any time within the policy period.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why is hospitalisation covered only if there is treatment involved?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The plan aims to cover those who are hospitalised due to sickness or injuries and therefore treatment must be involved.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I claim my surgical expenses if they have been fully reimbursed by my employer or another insurance policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If your surgical expenses have been fully reimbursed by a third party, you will not receive further reimbursement from HospitalSurance under surgical benefit. However, you are still entitled to daily hospital cash benefit if you are hospitalised due to a covered medical condition.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I manage my insurance policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call Insurance Service Hotline at (852)2867 8678 should you have any queries about your policy, or manage your policy at ease by e-Policy Servicing after logging on to HSBC Internet Banking if you are a HSBC internet banking customer. This online service provides you with 24-hour access to your policy details and allows you to submit policy service requests without hassle.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is medical examination required?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Applying for HospitalSurance is simple and easy. You are not required to have medical check-up which means you are free from any additional medical check-up fee.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I get my 30% no claim bonus?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have not made a claim for five consecutive years, you will receive a cash refund of 30% of the premiums you have paid. This refund will be credited automatically to the account which you have used to pay your premiums.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Does the coverage include hospitals outside Hong Kong?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are away from Hong Kong for less than 90 days at the time of your hospitalisation, you will be covered at any hospital anywhere in the world as long as the hospital is legally constituted and registered.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is hospitalisation in relation to pregnancy covered under the policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. Any claims in respect of pregnancy, childbirth (including diagnostic tests for pregnancy and surgical delivery), miscarriage, abortion and pre-natal or postnatal care are excluded.<br>
</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I manage my policy?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call 2867 8678 should you have any queries about your policy, or manage your policy at ease by e-Policy Servicing after logging on to HSBC Internet Banking if you are a HSBC internet banking customer. This online service provides you with 24-hour access to your policy details and allows you to submit policy service requests without hassle.<br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>
